main event: An F-82 aircraft observed an unidentified object traveling at high speed, making multiple turns, and changing altitude in Japan on 1 February 1951.
interesting points: The object was silvery in color, circular in shape, and approximately the size of a C-47 airplane.
Weather conditions were clear with no unusual phenomena reported at the time of the sighting.
The tactical control center had good contact with the F-82 but did not detect another blip on the scope.
A weather balloon release was suggested as a possible explanation for the sighting.
The headquarter concurred with the evaluation that exercised sound and ensured judgment in the handling of the matter.
photographs: No photographs included in the report
